poem:
### A Change in Air  

The winds have shifted slightly,  
rustling headlines like autumn leaves.  
A chorus of uncertainty,  
whispering through silent streets.  
Faith, once cemented, now feels  
more like sand grains slipping  
through cupped hands.  
Even the birds perch differently,  
watchful in the pause  
between breezes.
